brand_essence.personality: A friendly, trustworthy brand that values clarity and simplicity. Icons should feel like a breath of fresh air — light, airy, and instantly understandable.
brand_essence.visual_metaphor: Light and space — every element earns its place through purpose, not decoration

backgrounds.usage: Always use pure white (#FFFFFF) as primary background. Off-white for subtle layering only.

usage_rules: Primary blue (#3B82F6) for main icon strokes and focal elements
Secondary emerald (#10B981) for success states and positive indicators
Tertiary violet (#8B5CF6) for premium or special features only
Use muted versions (*_muted) for subtle fills at 20-30% opacity
Neutrals for secondary strokes, shadows, and supporting elements
Maximum 2 accent colors per icon composition
Never use black (#000000) — use neutral-900 (#1E293B) instead

geometry.viewbox: 0 0 64 64 — base viewbox for all icons, scale proportionally
geometry.padding: Minimum 12.5% padding inside icon bounds (8px on 64px icon)
geometry.shapes: Geometric primitives only: circles, rounded rectangles, lines. No organic or hand-drawn shapes.

stroke_system.caps: round — all stroke endpoints use round caps
stroke_system.joins: round — all stroke corners use round joins
stroke_system.consistency: Use 1.5px base weight for 90% of strokes. Reserve 2px+ for intentional emphasis only.

shadows.none: No shadow — default for most icons

depth_system.no_glows: Never use glow effects. This is a flat, clean aesthetic.
depth_system.no_gradients_on_strokes: Strokes are always solid colors, never gradients.
depth_system.fill_gradients: Subtle top-to-bottom gradients allowed on fills, max 10% lightness shift within same hue.

fill_system.outline_only: Default style — strokes with no fill, transparent interior
fill_system.duotone: Stroke in accent color + light fill (muted color at 20-30% opacity)
fill_system.solid_accent: Filled shapes in accent color — use sparingly for emphasis
rules: Duotone adds warmth while maintaining airiness
Solid fills only for small accent elements, not entire icons
White fill with colored stroke for container shapes

typography_in_icons.font: Geometric sans-serif (Inter, SF Pro, Geist style)
typography_in_icons.sizing: Labels should be legible but not dominant — roughly 10-14% of icon height
typography_in_icons.usage: Minimal text. Numbers for steps (1, 2, 3). Single-word labels only. Never sentences.

composition.alignment: Center-aligned for standalone icons. Left-to-right flow for process diagrams.
composition.balance: Symmetric or near-symmetric for icons. Visual weight evenly distributed.
composition.negative_space: Generous white space. Icons should breathe. At least 15% margin from bounds.
composition.focal_point: Single clear focal point per icon. For flows, the current/active step is focal.
composition.layering: Maximum 2 layers: primary element and optional subtle background shape.
composition.density: Low to medium. Avoid cramming multiple concepts into one icon.

flow_diagram_rules.step_spacing: Equal spacing between steps. Minimum 24px gap at base size.
flow_diagram_rules.connectors: Thin lines (1px) or arrows connecting steps. Subtle gray (#CBD5E1) or primary blue.
flow_diagram_rules.step_indicators: Numbered circles (1, 2, 3, 4) or icon-in-circle for each step
flow_diagram_rules.active_state: Current/highlighted step uses primary color fill. Others use outline only.
flow_diagram_rules.labels: Short labels below each step. Medium weight, neutral-700 color.

consistency_rules: ALL icons use the same stroke weight system (1.5px base)
ALL icons use the same corner radius (8px for medium elements)
ALL backgrounds are pure white (#FFFFFF) unless intentionally layered
ALL strokes use round caps and round joins
ALL icons maintain minimum 15% padding from bounds
ALL accent colors come from the defined palette — no custom colors
ALL shadows fall straight down (no angled shadows)
ALL flows read left-to-right with equal step spacing
avoid: Dark backgrounds — this is a light-mode-only style guide
Filled icons without outline — feels too heavy
More than 2 accent colors per composition
Decorative elements that don't serve meaning
